page-better-life-framework-description: Use this resource to help you understand more about each level and build empathy for yourself and the people around you.
page-better-life-framework-filters-descr: Use Filters To Focus On The Relevant Perspectives You Want To Understand.
page-better-life-framework-profile-1-tit: Happiness Is Getting What I Need
page-better-life-framework-profile-1-des: Once I get what I need, I will be happy.
page-better-life-framework-profile-2-tit: Happiness Is Getting What I Want
page-better-life-framework-profile-2-des: The more I get what I want, the happier I will become.
page-better-life-framework-profile-3-tit: Happiness Is Learning From My Experiences
page-better-life-framework-profile-3-des: If I can find the correct view of the world, I will be happy.
page-better-life-framework-profile-4-des: The more we are free to do what we want, without hurting others, the happier we will be.
page-better-life-framework-profile-5-des: It's not about me, its about we. Fulfillment comes when I am my best self and contributing to others.
page-better-life-framework-level-1-descr: Life is about dealing with my needs and feeling good by getting what I need.
page-better-life-framework-level-1-unloc: I'm desperately trying to do what I need to survive in this world. If my body needs it, I'll take/do it.
page-better-life-framework-level-2-descr: Life is about pleasing others (or the gods) so that they give us what we need.
page-better-life-framework-level-2-unloc: I can't take care of myself, so I need to please others so they give me what I need to survive.
page-better-life-framework-level-3-descr: Life is about getting what I want by taking or creating advantages for myself.
page-better-life-framework-level-3-unloc: I'm the main character. No one else is going to take care of me better than me, so I need to make sure I get what I want.
page-better-life-framework-level-4-descr: Life is about knowing what's right and what's wrong and making sure others do the right thing, too.
page-better-life-framework-level-4-unloc: I found what what works for me and my tribe, and everyone should do it too. Why can't they understand that what I'm doing is good for them?
page-better-life-framework-level-5-descr: Life is about knowing how to make good things happen, keeping the benefits, and always improving.
page-better-life-framework-level-5-unloc: I'm aware that people have different wants, so I'm trying to create a system that would help everyone get what they want.
page-better-life-framework-level-6-descr: Life is about being free to be whoever we are. If we stopped telling others what to do, we would have peace.
page-better-life-framework-level-6-unloc: I am aware that systems don't work on everyone. It might be better if there was no structure.
page-better-life-framework-level-7-descr: Life is about drawing boundaries, saying no is for the best. Who I am and what I want changes often.
page-better-life-framework-level-7-unloc: I accept that people should be free to be themselves, but I need to protect myself from having my boundaries crossed.
page-better-life-framework-level-8-descr: Life is an experiment. All we can do is the best that we know, so we should all know more.
page-better-life-framework-level-8-unloc: I accept that people will cross my boundaries, so I should do my best to be curious and spend time to understand why.
page-better-life-framework-level-9-descr: Life is about learning where and how to shine the light. I am not the main character, I am just the spotlight. What is revealed is what I illuminate.
page-better-life-framework-level-9-unloc: I understand everyone is on their own journey, and all we can do is love them where they are at.
page-better-life-framework-perspective-1: From birth, our primary focus is to fulfill basic needs like eating, sleeping, and attending to our bodily functions.
We recognize the presence of others and our dependence on them for basic needs.
We realize that while others may help take care of our basic needs, everyone looks out for their own wants and if we want to get what we want, we need to get it ourselves.
Upon achieving our goals, we often find ourselves seeking deeper meaning and purpose beyond material gains.
We start questioning societal norms and explore our own paths to success, gaining confidence in our ability to shape our lives.
We notice the limitations of rigid systems and recognize the need for adaptability and personal judgment.
We understand that having power (influence, wealth, etc.) enable us to set boundaries without constraints and prioritize personal well-being.
With abundant time, we can be intellectually curious with those others who will intrude on our boundaries.
We reach a stage where we can love and acceptance to others unconditionally, regardless of their circumstances.
page-better-life-framework-perspective-2: Our actions are driven by immediate physical sensations and needs.
We notice that others have senses, desires, and feelings, and respond to what I see in others to get what I need.
We learn to delay gratification, thinking about long-term implications rather than immediate desires.
We seek belonging and acceptance, often conforming to social norms or influencing others to align with our beliefs.
We adopt logical thinking and objective observation, relying on empirical evidence and rational thought.
We become aware of multiple valid perspectives, understanding that reality is complex and multifaceted, and strive to make everyone feel accomodated through rejection of structure.
We see how systems are related, interdependent, and synergistic (or clashing) and strive for harmony and balance.
We introspect and question everything, understanding ourselves as narratives shaped by our experiences.
We observe, understand, protect, honor, and allow all forms of life and phenomena.
page-better-life-framework-perspective-3: Like hunger driving us to eat, our basic needs dictate our actions.
We understand reciprocal relationships - helping others to ensure our own needs are met. We cannot tell the difference between people and things.
We engage in exchanges, always expecting something in return for our efforts.
We understand that others may think differently than us, but are sure that what we want and believe is the right thing.
We create systems to optimize our lives and help different people work together.
We embrace freedom and individual expression, often rejecting conventional structures.
We set limits to maintain order and protect personal and collective well-being.
We realize that people will push your limits even if there are consequences. Let's just be curious.
We have awareness of what perspective we are operating in at all times, and recognize our power to choose our focus.
page-better-life-framework-perspective-4: Focused on survival and immediate needs. 100,000 years old.
Social bonds and community needs come to the forefront. 50,000 years old.
Hierarchical structures dominate, with power concentrated in the hands of a few. 10,000 years old.
Structured governance emerges, with collective identity and societal norms. 5,000 years old.
Market forces drive societal changes, emphasizing individual success and merit. Beginning 1600s.
Focus shifts to equitable distribution and communal welfare. Beginning 1800s.
Global awareness and collective responsibility take precedence. Beginning mid-1900s.
Individuals fully acknowledge and embrace their interconnectedness with society while maintaining their personal identity and autonomy. Beginning late 1900s.
Visionary societies, potentially shaped by the Co-x3 Family Foundation, emphasizing holistic well-being and interconnectedness.
